datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to Mars rovers, space probes, and autonomous exploration vehicles.

columns.name: has_autonomous_navigation
columns.description: Indicates whether the vehicle is capable of fully autonomous navigation without immediate Earth-based intervention.

columns.name: max_daily_wind_speed
columns.description: Maximum wind speed recorded in kilometers per hour on a given day at the vehicle's location.

columns.name: energy_storage_capacity
columns.description: Represents the total energy storage capacity of the vehicle, which is crucial for supporting high-performance computing over long missions.

columns.name: mission_duration
columns.description: Specifies the planned operational timeline of the vehicle in days.

columns.name: average_daily_temperature
columns.description: Average daily temperature in Celsius degrees at the location of the vehicle.

columns.name: robotic_maintenance_sessions
columns.description: Number of maintenance and repair sessions performed on-site by robotic systems.

columns.name: years_since_last_survey
columns.description: Number of years since the last survey was conducted in the area by any exploration vehicle.

columns.name: past_turbulent_conditions
columns.description: Indicates if the vehicle has historically reported turbulent conditions, which include high wind speeds or extreme temperatures.

columns.name: remote_control_capabilities
columns.description: Indicates the presence of remote control capabilities enabling distant manipulation and interventions.

columns.name: new_geographical_features_found
columns.description: Number of new geographical features discovered by the vehicle

columns.name: communication_system_frequency
columns.description: Operational frequency of the vehicle's communication system, measured in GHz.

columns.name: communication_delay_tolerance
columns.description: Vehicle's ability to operate effectively despite communication delays with Earth-based control centers, important for autonomous decision-making.

columns.name: optical_imaging_resolution
columns.description: Resolution of the optical imaging system on the vehicle, measured in megapixels

columns.name: terrain_type
columns.description: Type of terrain where the vehicle is exploring

columns.name: AI_decision_making_capabilities
columns.description: Indicates whether the vehicle is equipped with artificial intelligence capabilities to make decisions independently.

columns.name: habitat_markers_found
columns.description: Count of biological or geological markers identified by the explorer that indicate past or potential habitats.

columns.name: computational_power_rating
columns.description: Rating of the vehicle's onboard computational hardware, indicating its capability to process complex algorithms.

columns.name: sensor_technology_types
columns.description: Counts the types of sensor technologies equipped on the vehicle, indicating its capability to handle diverse environmental data.

columns.name: operation_time_years
columns.description: Number of years the vehicle has been operational on Mars

columns.name: task_complexity_score
columns.description: A numerical score that rates the complexity of tasks the vehicle can perform on a scale from 1 to 10.

columns.name: terrain_complexity
columns.description: A categorical ranking of the surveyed terrain's complexity, affecting navigation and survey capabilities.

columns.name: historical_findings
columns.description: Binary indication if historical findings were previously reported in the current operational region of the vehicle

columns.name: communication_bandwidth
columns.description: The maximum data transmission capacity of the vehicle's communication system, measured in Mbps, which is crucial for high-speed data transmission to and from Earth.

columns.name: number_of_sensors
columns.description: Total number of sensors equipped on the vehicle

columns.name: communication_attempts
columns.description: Number of attempts made to communicate with the control station per day.

columns.name: power_fluctuations
columns.description: Count of significant power fluctuations per week detected in the vehicle.

columns.name: seasonal_temperature_variation
columns.description: Categorical indication of the level of temperature changes observed over seasons

columns.name: mission_duration_days
columns.description: Total duration of the mission expected or experienced, measured in days.

columns.name: system_update_frequency
columns.description: Number of critical system updates received per year

columns.name: communication_success_ratio
columns.description: Ratio of successful communications sessions to total communication attempts with mission control

queries.question: Is there a relationship between historical findings in exploration areas and the frequency of communication attempts, occurrences of power fluctuations, and the time elapsed since the last survey?
queries.true_hypothesis: Historical findings in exploration areas are more likely if there have been more than 50 communication attempts per day, significant power fluctuations per week detected in the vehicle, and the survey in the area was conducted more than five years ago.
